actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB; Treasury Department; Health and Human Services Department.

official_title: A bill to amend the Social Security Act and the Internal Revenue Code to provide more consistent Social Security coverage for U.S. citizens employed by foreign subsidiaries of American business: Elimination of requirement that American employer be a corporation.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code and title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to permit domestic corporations to enter into agreements with the Secretary of Health and Human Services to extend social security coverage to U.S. citizens employed by foreign affiliates of such corporations. (Currently, such social security coverage may be extended only to U.S. citizens employed by foreign subsidiaries of domestic corporations.) Reduces the stock ownership requirement which qualifies a foreign trade or business as a foreign affiliate for purposes of such Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Social Security Act and the Internal Revenue Code to provide more consistent Social Security coverage for U.S. citizens employed by foreign subsidiaries of American business: Elimination of requirement that American employer be a corporation.
